page.title: 14RISELEY CUBS
page.content: The correct name for the cub pack in the village is 24th Bedfordshire, Riseley. We belong to the Ouse Valley District in the county of Bedfordshire a district with only 5 cub packs, 4 scout troops and one beaver colony. Riseley cubs meet on Tuesday evenings at Margaret Beaufort School from 6.30 p.m. till 8.00 p.m. The uniform is the same as for all cubs, the only difference being the colour of the scarf which is all red for both the cubs and scouts of the village. We start the meeting with 'Grand Howl' and 'Flag Break' then inspection. We usually have a game or two followed by any work the cubs have been asked to do for various badges. At the present time we have only l4 cubs. It has been as high as 30 boys with a waiting list.
